page.title: 12Hangleton
page.content: Residents dig up oyster shells in their gardens, apparently a sign of Roman occupation.All but 4 families in the old farming community died during the Black Death.Hangleton did not develop until 1931,now ten thousand people live there.Twenty houses are being built now on the land available. St Helen's Church celebrated its 900th anniversary with a Gift Day and Flower Festival.The Hangleton Project is based at the Church Hall to encourage local groups and runs a community cafe.Hangleton Community Association is looking for premises. Hangleton Manor dated 1545 is the oldest building in Hove.A 2 year, Â£9 000 project is underway to restore the dovecote. Residents enjoy free access to the Downs for recreation and are worried about the proposed Brighton by-pass.
